Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Kafka producer wrapper class that simplifies message sending to Kafka topics, handles message formatting, and manages producer lifecycle.

Class Description: KafkaProducerWrapper is a utility class that encapsulates Kafka producer functionality, providing methods to send messages (with optional keys), batch send messages, and properly manage producer resources. It automatically generates a unique topic name for message sending.

Attributes:
_producer: KafkaProducer - The underlying Kafka producer instance
_topic: str - The Kafka topic name (automatically generated with UUID)

Methods:
__init__: () -> None - Initializes the Kafka producer with bootstrap servers and generates a unique topic name
send: (message: str | tuple[str, str]) -> None - Sends a single message to the Kafka topic (message can be either a plain string or a key-value tuple)
fill: (messages: Iterable[str | tuple[str, str]]) -> None - Sends multiple messages to the Kafka topic and flushes the producer
close: () -> None - Properly closes the Kafka producer to release resources
topic: () -> str - Property that returns the generated topic name
